channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: Judge rules immigration officers in Minneapolis can't detain peaceful protesters
item.description: Officers in the Minneapolis-area participating in a U.S. immigration enforcement operation can't detain or tear gas peaceful protesters who aren't obstructing authorities, a judge ruled Friday.
item.content:encoded:
Officers in the Minneapolis-area participating in a U.S. immigration enforcement operation can't detain or tear gas peaceful protesters who aren't obstructing authorities, a judge ruled Friday.

(Image credit: John Locher)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Justice Department opens investigation into Minnesota governor and Minneapolis mayor
item.description: Federal prosecutors are investigating Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey. In response to the news, Frey said in a social media post: "I will not be intimidated."
item.content:encoded:
Federal prosecutors are investigating Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey. In response to the news, Frey said in a social media post: "I will not be intimidated."

(Image credit: Stephen Maturen)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: No sign of new protests in Iran as a hard-line cleric calls for executions
item.description: A Iran returns to an uneasy calm after protests led to a violent crackdown, a senior cleric is calling for the death penalty for detained demonstrators. His sermon Friday also threatened U.S. President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
A Iran returns to an uneasy calm after protests led to a violent crackdown, a senior cleric is calling for the death penalty for detained demonstrators. His sermon Friday also threatened U.S. President Trump.

(Image credit: Ebrahim Noroozi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Measles is spreading fast in S.C. Here's what it says about vaccine exemptions
item.description: More than 550 people have contracted measles in Spartanburg County, S.C., in a fast-growing outbreak. Like a majority of U.S. counties, nonmedical exemptions to school vaccination are also rising.
item.content:encoded:
More than 550 people have contracted measles in Spartanburg County, S.C., in a fast-growing outbreak. Like a majority of U.S. counties, nonmedical exemptions to school vaccination are also rising.

(Image credit: Ken Ruinard)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: It took 75 governors to elect a woman. Spanberger will soon be at Virginia's helm
item.description: Abigail Spanberger, a former CIA officer and three-term congresswoman, is breaking long-held traditions on inauguration day. She says she wants her swearing-in to showcase the state's modern vibrancy.
item.content:encoded:
Abigail Spanberger, a former CIA officer and three-term congresswoman, is breaking long-held traditions on inauguration day. She says she wants her swearing-in to showcase the state's modern vibrancy.

(Image credit: Tyrone Turner)
item.dc:creator: Margaret Barthel

item.title: For those with addiction, going into and coming out of prison can be a minefield.
item.description: Many jails and prisons around the country don't provide medication treatment for opioid use disorder. Studies show that medication makes recovery more likely and reduces the risk of overdose death.
item.content:encoded:
Many jails and prisons around the country don't provide medication treatment for opioid use disorder. Studies show that medication makes recovery more likely and reduces the risk of overdose death.

(Image credit: Ash Adams for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Cassandra

item.title: Trump struck deals with 16 drug companies. But they're still raising prices this year
item.description: All 16 drug companies that inked deals with the Trump administration over the past few months still raised some of their prices for 2026.
item.content:encoded:
All 16 drug companies that inked deals with the Trump administration over the past few months still raised some of their prices for 2026.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: This hospice has a bold new mission: saving lives
item.description: A hospice in Uganda asked itself: Can we do more than ease the pain of dying? Can we actually prevent deaths from cervical and breast cancer?
item.content:encoded:
A hospice in Uganda asked itself: Can we do more than ease the pain of dying? Can we actually prevent deaths from cervical and breast cancer?

(Image credit: Brian Simpson for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Joanne Cavanaugh Simpson

item.title: Canada agrees to cut tariff on Chinese EVs in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products
item.description: Breaking with the United States, Canada has agreed to cut its 100% tariff on Chinese electric cars in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Friday.
item.content:encoded:
Breaking with the United States, Canada has agreed to cut its 100% tariff on Chinese electric cars in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Friday.

(Image credit: Sean Kilpatrick)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What do eggs, Grok and Greenland have in common? They're all quiz-worthy! Are you?
item.description: See if you can get a perfect score for once.
item.content:encoded:
See if you can get a perfect score for once.

(Image credit: Robyn Beck/AFP via Getty Images; Michael Loccisano/Getty Images; Frazer Harrison/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris
